moves.1. e4: Beans and I discussed annotating this one after it was over, and now she's being lazy about doing it, so here we are.
moves.1... e5 2. c4 Nc6 3. g4: This opening doesn't make a ton of sense to me currently, but she did a pretty good job through a lot of this game. I still feel like d3, Nf3, or Nc3 would all be better moves than this one.
moves.3... g6: Looking to fiancetto, of course. Not sure what I was thinking at the time, but I don't see a problem with it yet.
moves.4. d3 Bg7 5. g5: Poor development here. That pawn isn't leading to any advantage that I can see and now she's given up tempo to black by moving it twice.
moves.5... Nge7 6. c5: Moving a second pawn twice. Six moves in and only four pawns have been moved. Develop the minor pieces!
moves.6... O-O 7. Nc3 d6 8. cxd6 cxd6 9. f4 a6: Offering the trade Nxd5 and then exd5, but it leads to white stacking pawns. Be3 would have been better.
moves.11... Nxd5 12. exd5 exf4: Opening the file on white's King to hopefully break the castle. Also going to try to take advantage of the N's threat on e2.
moves.13. Bxf4 Re8+ 14. Ne2 Nxe2 15. Bxe2 Bg4: Decent pin, but not much to do with it yet.
moves.16. Rc1: Taking the rook to the empty file, always a good practice. This move overlooks Bxb2, though, so black wins the pawn.
moves.16... Bxb2 17. Rc2: Black wins another pawn shortly with Qa5+, with the choice of either a3 or d5.
moves.17... Qa5+ 18. Bd2 Qxa3: I notice my mistake. Qxd5 would have been the stronger move due to the central Q and the additional threat on the R at h1. This move wins a pawn, sure, but threatens nothing and motivates white to potentially take control.
moves.19. Rc7 Qxd3: Moving to make good on all the threats to e2.
moves.20. Be3: Good move, Beans. Negates all my threats and forces the Q to retreat. Black still has a material advantage, but the positions can be pretty swiftly reversed if played right from here on out.
moves.20... Rxe3 21. Qxd3 Rxd3 22. Bxd3: I see nothing wrong with white's play here. Black should have Qxd1 first and come away with Bxd1 followed by Rxd3+. I messed up again and now have very little in the way of material advantage and white has the slightly stronger position.
moves.26. Kf2: ...but this was a mistake. If black were a better player, he would capitalize with the discovered check and be up a B...
moves.26... Bxd5: ...but he makes this stupid move instead.
moves.27. Rxe3 Bxe3+ 28. Kxe3: Black has managed to blunder his way into a bad position and a material deficit. Great job.
moves.28... Kf8 29. h4 Ke8: White just needs to clear out some space and protect those pawns.
moves.30. Kd4 Bh1 31. Rxb7: Fatal mistake. This is the one bad move that undoes all the previous good ones.
moves.31... Bxb7 32. Bc4 a5 33. Kc3 d5 34. Bb5: This game is now effectively over. White played a good game through to move 30 and just made a bad move. Throughout, though, Beans did a good job of capitalizing on my mistakes and protecting her territory.

gameName: You have your auto-decline set to at least 10 days per move, so take your time and really look over your moves.
